Name: French Bread
Description: Long, thin loaf that is distinguishable by its length and crisp crust. Traditional bread of France.

Name: Ciabatta
Description: Ciabatta is somewhat elongated, broad, and flat, and is baked in many variations. Our version is made from locally sourced wheat flour, olive oil, salt, yeast, and water.

Name: Italian Bread
Description: Delicious loaf originating in Italy that is cruncy braid loaded with sesame seeds

Name: Rye Bread
Description: Type of bread made with various proportions of flour from rye grain. Our rye bread is dark rye.

Name: Banana Bread
Description: You must be absolutely bananas not to try our Banana bread! We grew them ourselves, and peel them just before baking.

Name: Bagel
Description: Historically spelled beigel, it is shaped by hand into the form of a ring of yeasted wheat dough.

Name: Sourdough Bread
Description: Made by the fermentation of dough using naturally occuring yeast. Has more of a sour taste, but even more of a following!

Name: Cornbread
Description: Sweet, fluffy, and perfect for a cozy meal. This not-too-sweet recipe will blow your socks off!

Name: Pumpernickel
Description: Heavy, slightly sweet rye bread, made with a sourdough starter and coarsely ground rye

Name: Texas Toast
Description: Square toasted bread topped with melted butter and freshly-cut garlic. A cut above the rest!
